title: Radha Krishna
summary: Radha-Krishna (IAST rādhā-kṛṣṇa, Sanskrit: राधा कृष्ण) are collectively known within Hinduism as the combined forms of feminine as well as the masculine realities of God.[1] Radha and Krishna are the primeval forms of God and his pleasure potency (Hladini Shakti) respectively in several Vaishnavite school of thought.[2]
